result.execSummary:
The defendant Demon N Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 3/1/2019.  Failure to pay will reslt in an entry of civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two in 15CF3806; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 12 days, 2/3/2015 to 2/7/2015 and 1/29/2016 to 2/5/2016.
--Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program only after serving two (2) years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant may not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

Fine set at zero.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under S. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demon N Smith in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Demon N Smith in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 
Continued Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense, defendant and additional statement all made on 01-29-2016.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 and count 2 in 15CF3806 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 12 days (02-03-2015 to 02-07-2015 and 01-29-2016 to 02-05-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program only after serving 2 years of initial confinement. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Cash bail on deposit shall apply. Any remaining balance  shall be due no later than 03-01-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Exhibit List- Sentencing Hearing on 01-29-2016 & 02-05-2016, received and filed. tk
Letter from the defendant received and filed. tk

Entry update 12-10-2015 both cases PSI are to be without recommendations.

Defendant Demon N Smith in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter. Paul Hauer on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 01-29-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
